awd_titl_txt: Hydrothermal Plume Particle Flux and Its Biochemical        Implications
awd_abstract_narration: Objectives are to (1) define temporal variability in                    suspended and settling hydrothermal particle fluxes and                         understand the relationship of the fluxes to regional deep sea                  flow and (2) to use key compositional variables to define                       mechanisms and rates of particle removal.  The data from two                    moorings in Endeavor segment of Juan de Fuca Ridge will be used.                Data from one of the moorings will extend the time series of data               obtained from earlier moorings; the other mooring will provide                  data from closer to the vent field than earlier moorings.                       %%%                                                                                     One component of the seafloor hydrothermal system is the                plume discharge into the deep ocean.  Little is understood about                the details of this process.  The principal investigator on this                project is one of the leaders in the field on this subject and                  this project is an extension of his pioneering work.
